question: Balance the following chemical equation and identify the type of reaction: Mg + HCl → MgCl₂ + H₂
answer: Mg + 2HCl → MgCl₂ + H₂. This is a single displacement (single replacement) reaction where magnesium displaces hydrogen from hydrochloric acid.

explanation.en: To balance: 1 Mg atom on left needs 1 on right (already balanced), 2 Cl atoms on right need 2 on left (requiring 2 HCl), 2 H atoms from 2 HCl form 1 H₂ molecule. Single displacement occurs when a more reactive element displaces a less reactive one.
explanation.bm: Untuk menyeimbang: 1 atom Mg di kiri perlu 1 di kanan (sudah seimbang), 2 atom Cl di kanan perlu 2 di kiri (memerlukan 2 HCl), 2 atom H dari 2 HCl membentuk 1 molekul H₂. Penggantian tunggal berlaku apabila unsur yang lebih reaktif menggantikan yang kurang reaktif.

hint.en: Count atoms of each element on both sides and think about what type of reaction involves one element replacing another.
hint.bm: Kira atom setiap unsur di kedua-dua belah dan fikirkan jenis tindak balas yang melibatkan satu unsur menggantikan yang lain.
